summary: An introductory email from an FBI Special Agent to a potential witness, arranging an interview for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email outlines the investigative team, which includes FBI agents, an NYPD detective, and Assistant U.S. Attorneys.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a primary subject of the FBI's investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a primary subject of the FBI's investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same FBI investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking.

events.title: FBI Introductory Email Sent
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends an introductory email to a potential witness to arrange an interview for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Planned Witness Interview
events.description: The FBI agent proposes conducting a video conference interview with the recipient in the first week of March 2021.

keyFacts: The FBI is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for child exploitation and human trafficking as of February 2021.
The investigative team includes an FBI Special Agent, an NYPD detective on a joint task force, and three Assistant U.S. Attorneys.
The FBI is seeking to interview anyone who could have information about Epstein and/or Maxwell.
The communication indicates international coordination, with a UK police detective copied on the email.
